experience: You and Jon Wolske Speaker both know Clifford Wong, Scott Salkin, and 1 other

This picture is from the good ol' days - early 2009 (pre Amazon acquisition).  I was one year into my Zappos career when we debuted at number 23 on Fortune's 'Best 100 Companies to Work For' list.  I remember my mom being so proud of me and buying a bunch of the magazines to show her friends that her son was featured in the centerfold of a wildly popular business publication.  It's a little sad to think about, but I would likely still be at Zappos if Amazon never swooped in.  Best company culture ever!  Look at us, Cat Schnaidt!

Aaaand it's READY! So darn excited. Here's my new speaker trailer, and, incidentally, the first video longer than 2 minutes I've ever produced and edited. (I'm also available for birthday parties and bar mitzvahs. SpongeBob outfit available for a small fee.) Shouts to Andrew Davis and Carla Johnson who were behind the scenes lobbing me softballs during the confessional parts.
Over the last few months, I read thousands of posts and articles. This is my personal list of overused and exhausted topics and content ideas:
1. I lost 100 million, then a truck hit me. While I was waiting for an ambulance a dog peed on me. Then things took a turn for the worse.
2. Nobody wanted to give … a chance! Except me.
3. I wake up every day at 4AM to go to the gym. Then I work hard till 2AM. After 14 days I overslept. I hated myself. Then I realized: it's ok, I am human
16. Three hour videos without any structure, story or point. Nobody has time for that!
17. *Meta alert* Lists about what not to write.
Let's all be more creative! Thank you! :)
Agree/Disagree? Which topic do you think has been overused? ⬇
✅ FOLLOW me for #LinkedIn tips & tricks, sales & marketing strategies and posts about #leadership.
Rock Star Speaker and Culture Evangelist

Keynote speaker, motivational/inspirational speaker sharing the ideas and approaches that great companies have used to create great cultures, customer service that is admired and brands that don't need too much explaining. Telling stories from Zappos.com experience, along with other great cultures and customer service leaders. My goal is to leave each speech with real actions that the audience can take and work on TODAY. If we can make the world a better place by changing what we can NOW, the future of work will be so much brighter! You and your employees can find real happiness - and real positive resultsAlso available for...Voice-over work for videosMaster of Ceremonies/event hostTrivia host - seriously!Celebrity lookalike - OK, I just look like me, but it's worth a try...

Designing T-shirts with 'Heart' and 'Warrior' themes. I've always messed around with making designs, now I'm sure I'll eventually get better at it since these designs are all available to the public!A portion of profits will be made as a donation to children's heart organizations. in 2016 our daughter was born with congenital heart disease. SHe is an inspirational warrior and reminds us every day that there is so much to be done to help families who experience similar stories.https://shop.spreadshirt.com/MendedHearts

Current Project is Missed the Messengerhttp://www.missedthemessenger.comhttp://www.reverbnation.com/missedthemessengerMusician, Audio Tech, Worship leaderBands include:Across the Tracks, Trisha Benton Band, Betty and the Liars, Nasty Habits, Beau Hodges Band, sub positions in many others (on-call player).Show tunes and other styles as wel.lChurches include (Volunteer and staff positions):Trinity UMC, Grace Point, Green Valley UMC, Life Baptist
400 E Stewart Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89101

Started in the Customer Loyalty Team. Moved into Zappos Insights, sharing the culture and service as Tours Lead. I helped build a tour experience and tours team and make the Zappos tour a business-tourist attraction in Vegas! 4 years ago I moved into the role of Culture Evangelist, jet-setting around the world! I get to share the company culture of the Zappos Family with people all day, every day, so basically I think I have the best job in the world!As 3rd Party coordinator I built new business offering use of campus space in downtown Las Vegas. Ground-up new business plan and processes to WOW clients who are looking for alternative venue spaces in which to hold their events.Working with stakeholders to ensure all parties are comfortable with processes as they pertain to the many aspects of business that may be affected.Building process documents and procedures for venue bookingCoordination of Production, Catering and security
Guitar and vocals, songwriting, bass and band-leader!http://www.facebook.com/beauhodgesbandhttp://www.reverbnation.com/beauhodgesbandRed Dirt Rock - New music from Vegas!
Started a table tennis club, played trumpet in band

recommendations: Fran Towey
President/CEO at Natural Partners, Inc.
November 3, 2017, Jon Wolske Speaker was a client of Fran’s

Jon was keynote speaker at Natural Partners' annual All-Hands In event in Scottsdale, AZ.  We believe very passionately that our culture differentiates us, and our work environment & company events [like our annual All-Hands] are designed to support our core values and aspiration for wellness in the world.  Given that background, selecting the right people to speak at our annual All-Hands is pretty important.  We asked Jon to come in and give us some of this learnings  on the subject of culture, teamwork, and growth, and help inspire the team as closed a great year, and prepared for a new year.  He nailed it, Jon is a great speaker.  He listened very carefully to what we were trying to accomplish, came in prepared, and was right on the money.  His style fit our team perfectly and everyone was actively engaged in Jon's message.  It helps that we enjoy having fun and we're a little rock and roll, as is Jon.  Jon is great guy, and very good at what he does.I highly recommend Jon if you're looking for a strong, passionate, fun, and motivational keynote speaker!

Ron Kaufman
Customer Experience Expert | Service Culture Consultant | Keynote Speaker | New York Times Bestselling Author
June 24, 2013, Ron worked with Jon Wolske Speaker but at different companies

Jonathan Wolske is a living, working, sharing example of the Culture of WOW! that distinguishes Zappos. His commitment to uplifting others with caring and contribution is evident from the moment you meet him. Jon has the background of understanding that comes from "being there" and "doing that" across many formative years and roles at Zappos. If you want to learn more about the what, why, and how that makes this company an icon of service, and uplifting service culture, Jonathan Wolske is an excellent person to learn from, and a pleasure to meet.

summary: Interested in having me speak at your company or event? please go to http://www.jonwolske.comHi! I'm a Speaker who loves to share everything I know about organizational culture and customer service! I am part of the Zappos Family, and have been for 9 years! Before that, I worked all kinds of jobs - and I think that helped me to become the Culture Evangelist that I am today. Through my experiences playing music on stage, working as a corporate trainer and doing customer service, I found a love of speaking and sharing with a hope that I can be a part of a movement that helps change the world.I have spoken for organizations new and old, small to large, non-profit to big moneymakers, since all organizations have culture and purposes, the message has been well received! I had the honor of participating in TEDxLoyolaMarymountU in April of 2013! copy and paste link for video: http://youtu.be/NW5BGsmpYXoAs a musician, I have over 22 years of experience. I play Bass, Guitar, sing Lead and Harmony Vocals as well as Songwriting and have Live performance and recording experience. You can find my ramblings about the wild world of music on my website: http://www.missedthemessenger.comAs an Audio Tech, I worked with concert systems from small to large, as a soundman and A2 and have worked as a bench tech preparing equipment for shows, building customized racks and repairing cabling and equipment that was broken in the field. Specialties: Keynote Speaking, public speaking, company culture, live tours, worship, Music, audio, guitar, bass  - http://www.jonwolske.com
